sections.html:
The tool produces a table whose columns of corresponds to the 7 databases offered for comparison and and whose rows can be switched to represent either the countries where the adaptation projects take place or the sectors that they concern. The cells of the table can be switched to show either the number of projects or the total amount of dollars (for the database that contains this information). To allow the comparison across datasets of different size, the absolute values are presented with the proportion relative to the total number of records or to the total amount of funding in each database.

In order to facilitate the comparison, the relative values of the cells of the table are visualized both as numbers and as repetition of glyphs each of which represents 1% of projects in the database or 1% of the total funding of the database[a].

Each source uses different codes to classify climate risks. For consistency, all codes were, where possible, mapped on to the UNDP ALM sectors:

  • agriculture / food security
  • coastal zone development
  • disaster risk reduction
  • health
  • infrastructure / risk management
  • natural resource management
  • rural development
  • water resources

The UNDP ALM codes did not comprehensively cover all those included in the other sources and so three additional codes were included:

  • education
  • government / trade / finance
  • other
